skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Professional web application testing and automation using Playwright with support for multiple browsers, mobile emulation, screenshot capture, network interception, and comprehensive test assertions. Use for: (1) E2E testing across browsers, (2) UI automation, (3) Form testing and validation, (4) Visual regression testing, (5) API mocking and interception, (6) Mobile responsive testing
skill.summary: Professional web application testing and automation using Playwright with support for multiple brows...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate web testing skill using the Playwright framework. It provides standard browser automation capabilities for testing purposes with no malicious code patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Manual browser testing is slow and error-prone. This skill provides automated end-to-end testing with Playwright for reliable cross-browser validation, form testing, and visual regression checks.
actual_capabilities: Create end-to-end tests for web applications across Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit
Automate form interactions including validation, file uploads, and multi-step workflows
Mock API responses and intercept network requests for controlled testing
Test mobile responsive designs with device emulation
Capture screenshots and videos for debugging test failures
Implement Page Object Model pattern for maintainable test code
limitations: Requires Playwright and browser installations to run tests
Tests run in isolated browser contexts and do not modify host system
Visual regression testing requires external image comparison library
Test code must be written in Python or JavaScript

use_cases.title: Automated E2E Testing
use_cases.description: Create reliable cross-browser test suites for web applications with Playwright automation.

use_cases.title: Form Validation Testing
use_cases.description: Verify form inputs, validation rules, and error messages across different browsers.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Regression Checks
use_cases.description: Integrate automated browser tests into deployment pipelines for continuous quality.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Page Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Playwright test that navigates to example.com and verifies the page title and h1 text match expected values.

prompt_templates.title: Form Interaction
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Playwright test for a contact form that fills name, email, and message fields, then submits and checks for success message.

prompt_templates.title: API Mocking
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a test that intercepts the /api/user endpoint and returns mock JSON data, then verifies the UI displays the mocked user information.

prompt_templates.title: Mobile Responsive
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Playwright test using iPhone 12 device emulation that verifies the mobile menu appears and navigation works on smaller viewports.

output_examples.input: Create a Playwright test for login functionality with valid credentials

best_practices: Use test IDs and semantic selectors instead of fragile CSS selectors tied to page structure
Leverage Playwright auto-waiting instead of manual sleep statements
Clear cookies and localStorage between tests to ensure test isolation
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoded sleep delays which cause flaky tests
Do not use position-based selectors like div:nth-child(3) that break on layout changes
Avoid test interdependencies where one test requires another to run first

faq.question: Which browsers does this skill support?
faq.answer: Playwright supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit for comprehensive cross-browser testing.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for tests?
faq.answer: Tests run in isolated browser contexts. Memory and CPU depend on the host system capabilities.

faq.question: Can I integrate with CI/CD systems?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes GitHub Actions and Docker examples for running tests in CI/CD pipelines.

faq.question: Is my test data kept private?
faq.answer: Tests run locally. No test data is sent to external servers. Browser contexts are isolated.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing intermittently?
faq.answer: Flaky tests often result from missing waits. Use Playwright auto-waiting and expect assertions instead of manual delays.

faq.question: How does this compare to Selenium or Cypress?
faq.answer: Playwright offers faster execution, better auto-waiting, and native support for multiple browsers with a unified API.
